column4: Eterm compiles properly on ubuntu feisty amd64, but then immediately segfaults upon running it.  is this amd64 specific?
don't know. if you like me to the source I can test it for you on plain old x86?
ok, the source is in cvs.  you need to compile libast as well as eterm: cvs -z3 -d:pserver:anonymous@anoncvs.enlightenment.org:/var/cvs/e co -P  eterm
libast source is where?
nm, found it
eterm doesn't compile at all. Complains about an undefined reference
this is  an autotools problem.  the versions necessary are automake 1.9.6, autoconf 2.61, libtool 1.5.22, m4 1.4.8.  also, did you compile and install libast first?
i don't expect you to change all the autofoo versions just to test this :)
thanks though
Compiled and installed libast as required. Never mind then. Thats alright, might we worth looking if theres some 64bit specific code available for it
yes, i am searching for that now.  if I see the developer in #e I'll ask also.
will try to compile with 32bit libs and see if that works.
it is a problem with compilation with 64bit libs.  if I compile with 32bit libs, everything works fine.
Glad to hear it
I just switched to 64bit.  am realizing that LDFLAGS is my friend :)
Can you link me to some info on LDFLAGS? I had quite a bit of problem with 64bit a while ago
to build with all 32bit libraries, you need to pass the options: LDFLAGS="-L/lib32 -L/usr/lib32 -Wl,-rpath,/lib32 -Wl,-rpath,/usr/lib32"
and then ./autogen.sh or ./configure as usual
you'll need to apt-get all the 32bit libs
great. thanks. Maybe when I reinstall for gutsy I will use 64bit apps :)
there are a lot of detractors for 64bit, but I like it :)
